summary: The Health Share Transparency Act of 2025 mandates increased transparency for health care sharing ministries. It requires these ministries to annually disclose financial and operational information to federal agencies and publish it publicly. They must also inform prospective and current members about coverage details, complaint processes, and the lack of guaranteed benefits, and mandates disclosure by entities enrolling individuals in such ministries on available tax credits, state plan eligibility, and benefit comparisons. The Federal Trade Commission will also publicly report on consumer complaints related to these ministries.
